intro: Schizocodon soldanelloides f. longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved Schizocodon, is a variant of the Schizocodon soldanelloides species. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the Boraginaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. This form is notable for its distinctive foliage and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
